project.name: MQTT Note - Obsidian Plugin
project.description: Obsidian plugin enabling seamless two-way communication between notes and MQTT broker
project.tech_stack: TypeScript, Node.js, Obsidian Plugin API, MQTT

project.repository: To be configured after project setup

documentation.architecture_notes: Two-way communication system: Notes with mqtt:true frontmatter publish to MQTT topics, incoming MQTT messages create/update notes in specified folder

mqttClient.ts.purpose: MQTT broker connection management and message handling

classes.name: MQTTClient
classes.description: Manages MQTT broker connection, publishing, and subscription with error handling and reconnection logic

methods.name: connect
methods.signature: connect(brokerUrl: string, username: string, password: string) -> Promise<void>
methods.description: Establishes connection to MQTT broker with authentication and retry logic
methods.returns: Promise that resolves when connection is established

methods.name: disconnect
methods.description: Gracefully disconnects from MQTT broker and cleans up resources
methods.returns: Promise that resolves when disconnection is complete

methods.name: publish
methods.description: Publishes message to specified MQTT topic with error handling
methods.returns: Promise that resolves when message is published

methods.name: subscribe
methods.signature: subscribe(topic: string, callback: (topic: string, payload: string) -> void) -> Promise<void>
methods.description: Subscribes to MQTT topic with message callback handler

parameters.topic: MQTT topic pattern to subscribe to (supports wildcards)
parameters.callback: Function called when messages are received

methods.returns: Promise that resolves when subscription is active

methods.name: isConnected
methods.description: Returns current connection status to MQTT broker
methods.returns: true if connected to broker, false otherwise

classes.name: NotePublisher

parameters.settings: Plugin settings for topic prefix and other configuration

methods.name: shouldPublishNote
methods.description: Checks if note should be published based on frontmatter mqtt:true setting

methods.name: generateTopic
methods.description: Generates MQTT topic from note title and configured prefix

methods.name: createPayload
methods.description: Creates JSON payload from note frontmatter and body content

parameters.note: Obsidian TFile object to extract content from

methods.returns: Promise resolving to JSON string payload

noteCreator.ts.purpose: Creates and updates Obsidian notes from incoming MQTT messages

classes.name: NoteCreator

methods.name: handleIncomingMessage

parameters.topic: MQTT topic the message was received on

methods.returns: Promise that resolves when note is created/updated

methods.name: createNoteFromMessage
methods.signature: createNoteFromMessage(topic: string, payload: string, folder: string) -> Promise<TFile>

architecture.main_flow: main.ts orchestrates plugin lifecycle -> loads settings -> initializes MQTT client -> sets up note publisher and creator -> registers commands and event handlers
architecture.data_flow: Outgoing: Notes with mqtt:true -> NotePublisher -> MQTTClient -> MQTT Broker; Incoming: MQTT Broker -> MQTTClient -> NoteCreator -> Obsidian Notes
architecture.configuration: Settings stored in Obsidian's plugin data, managed through MQTTNoteSettingTab UI with broker connection, topic prefixes, and folder configuration
architecture.key_components: MQTTClient (broker communication), NotePublisher (note-to-MQTT), NoteCreator (MQTT-to-note), Settings (configuration management)
architecture.integration_points: MQTT Broker (external), Obsidian Vault (file system), Obsidian Plugin API (UI and events)
